item.title: Oil Demand to Peak This Decade, IEA Says
item.description: Rising demand for crude oil is set to slow to a trickle within five years and peak before the end of the decade, as electric-vehicle uptake surges and developed nations rapidly transition to cleaner sources of energy.

item.title: Shell to Lift Dividend, Launch $5 Billion Buyback
item.description: The energy major Shell said it will share billions more from its record profits with investors while deepening its commitment to the oil-and-gas businesses that produce the highest returns. .

item.title: Brent Inches Higher Ahead of Federal Reserve Meeting
item.description: Oil futures were little changed in Europe as investors awaited the latest Fed rate decision, with the central bank “caught between a rock and a hard place” regarding inflation, said Commodity Research Group.

item.title: The Comforts of Campus Denunciation
item.description: Hear some talk that you dislike?

item.title: FTSE 100 Rises as Traders Weigh UK GDP Data, Await US Rate Decision
item.description: The FTSE 100 edged up early in the session, as traders reacted to U.K. economic growth data and looked ahead to the Fed interest rate decision.

item.title: Notable & Quotable: Speech at Virginia Tech
item.description: ‘When students filed this current lawsuit, a Virginia Tech tenured professor took to Twitter to publicly call the students ‘conservative s—tbags’ who were ‘suing the school because they’re bigots.’ ’

item.title: How to Think About the Trump Indictment: Readers Debate
item.description: A reckless disregard for the law or another victimless crime?

item.title: Alarmism Hurts Children With Gender Dysphoria
item.description: For many minors, this may be a transient phase of exploration rather than a permanent identity.

item.title: If Russia Loses, Don't Let China Win
item.description: Russian instability could be an opportunity for the Chinese.

item.title: Examples Are the True Test of Learning
item.description: They challenge students to demonstrate that they understand the concept.

item.title: Naspers Warns on Earnings
item.description: Naspers said it expected to report a 26%-33% fall in core earnings per share for 2023 and 2024, mostly due to lower profit contributions from its associates, China’s Tencent in particular.

item.title: A Slogan for a Biden-Trump Rematch in 2024
item.description: Inspired by 1960s campus antiwar protests.

item.title: 'The Whiskey Rebellion' Review: A Young Nation, Suddenly Tested
item.description: Escalating resistance to a new tax exacerbated a wider sense of crisis. The president decided to take the field himself as commander in chief.

item.title: Metals Mixed Ahead of Federal Reserve Meeting
item.description: Metal prices were mixed in London, with investors expecting a pause in Fed interest-rate hikes when the central bank reveals its decision later in the session.

item.title: Dollar Trades Flat Ahead of Fed's Rate Decision
item.description: The dollar was flat ahead of the Fed decision, with UBS saying Tuesday’s U.S. inflation data wasn’t soft enough to allow the central bank to call a final end to tightening.

item.title: Further Inversion of German Bund Curve Seen as Unlikely
item.description: The German Bund yield curve is unlikely to become more inverted from current levels, UniCredit Research said, and is only likely to happen if the ECB raises rates beyond 3.75%.

item.title: Casino Gets €1.1 Billion Approach From Teract Founders
item.description: Casino has received an offer for a capital injection of €200-€300 million from a group of businessmen, who said they intend to raise additional funds on behalf of the French grocer from other partners and interested existing creditors.

item.title: UK Economy Rebounds
item.description: U.K. GDP matched expectations with 0.2% growth in April, boosted by the services sector, though resilient high inflation and possible interest-rate rises could put a lid on an uplift through the year.

item.title: Shell to Raise Dividend, Boost Returns
item.description: Shell said it will lift its shareholder distribution to 30%-40% of cash flow, with a 15% increase in dividend, and will also launch share buybacks of at least $5 billion for the second half of 2023.

item.title: Toyota Shareholders Re-Elect Akio Toyoda to Board, Rejecting Activist Push
item.description: Some investor groups in the U.S. and Europe sought Toyoda’s ouster over his stance on electric vehicles.
